destinations.notes: 90 days within a 180-day period.

Stay of 90 days within a 180-day period.
Possible to extend once for an additional 90 days (total 180 days/year).

Part of the CA-4 Agreement (Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua, El Salvador). Stay counts collectively across these countries.
One of the most generous visa-free stays for Turkish citizens.
Part of the CA-4 Agreement; time spent in Guatemala, El Salvador, and Nicaragua counts toward the total.
Might need proof of onward ticket; different from Mainland China, which requires a visa.
Available at major airports. Extension possible for tourist stays.

destinations.visaType: Visa on Arrival in KRI (Kurdistan Region)
destinations.notes: Visa on Arrival is typically granted only for the Iraqi Kurdistan Region. For other regions of Iraq, a visa may be required beforehand.
Historically visa-free for Turkish citizens on short visits, but Japan introduced eVisa for certain passport holders. Check most recent regulations.

No visa needed for stays up to 90 days.

90 days within any 180-day period.

destinations.notes: Rules can be strict—confirm details before travel.

destinations.maxStay: No set limit for Turkish citizens

Within a 180-day period. May be subject to change due to ongoing conditions.

importantNote: Visa and entry regulations change frequently. Always verify with the destination’s official embassy, consulate, or immigration authority prior to travel. If you plan to work, study, or stay longer than the allowed period, you must obtain an appropriate visa.
